explanation: The claim is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires that pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever they are only used for reading. In OS_TimeBaseGetFreeRun the local pointer timebase is only used to read a field (timebase->freerun_time) and is never used to modify the object. It therefore can and should be declared as const OS_timebase_internal_record_t *timebase. Assigning the address of the non-const table element (the macro yields an OS_timebase_internal_record_t *) to a pointer-to-const is permitted (it adds const qualification), so there is no technical obstacle to making it const. Consequently the report that this code violates MISRA Rule 8.13 is correct.
